availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles S. Marshall (Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and circuit judge)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Bourbon County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas A. Marshall. Married to Emily V. Corbett Marshall in 1848. Father of Susan Marshall, Mary Marshall, Thomas C. Marshall, Lucey E. Marshall, Jacob Marshall, and Ann Marshall. Graduated from the Law Department of Transylvania University in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1842. Attorney in McCracken County, Kentucky, in 1850. Elected county attorney of Ballard County in 1856. Attorney in Ballard County in 1860. Circuit judge of the First Judicial District of Kentucky from 1862 to 1867.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 160A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 561.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, p. 139A.
"A Good Man Gone," Daily Missoulian (Missoula, MT), November 14, 1896, p. 1.
"C.S. Marshall Dead," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), November 14, 1896, p. 2.
